critique:
This executive order, issued by President Trump, declares a national emergency with respect to the situation in Mali, citing repeated violations of ceasefire arrangements, expansion of terrorist activities, drug trafficking, human rights abuses, and attacks against civilians and international forces. It blocks the property of individuals and entities determined to be involved in these activities and suspends the entry of such persons into the United States. The order relies on the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA), the National Emergencies Act (NEA), the United Nations Participation Act of 1945 (UNPA), and section 212(f) of the Immigration and Nationality Act of 1952. It authorizes the Secretary of the Treasury, in consultation with the Secretary of State, to implement the order and take necessary actions. The order also includes standard clauses regarding the authority of executive departments and agencies, budgetary matters, and the non-creation of enforceable rights or benefits.
